Format Numbers with Fixed Decimal Places

fmt.Rd

Format numeric values with a fixed number of decimal places, preserving trailing zeros for consistent display in tables and figures.

Usage

fmt(x, digits = 2, trim = TRUE)

Arguments

x

Numeric vector to format

digits

Number of decimal places (default = 2)

trim

Remove leading whitespace (default = TRUE)

Value

Character vector of formatted numbers

Examples

# Basic usage
fmt(1.5)       # "1.50"
#> [1] "1.50"
fmt(1.5, 3)    # "1.500"
#> [1] "1.500"
fmt(0.1, 2)    # "0.10"
#> [1] "0.10"

# Vector input
fmt(c(1, 1.5, 1.55, 1.555))  # "1.00" "1.50" "1.55" "1.56"
#> [1] "1.00" "1.50" "1.55" "1.55"

# With dplyr
# df |> mutate(mean_fmt = fmt(mean_val))
